attributes.comment:
To whom it may concern:

I have recently learned about the proposed increase in the fingerprinting fees and
application fees which will have a direct impact on adoptive parents seeking to
adopt out-of-country, as well as all immigrants seeking a better life in the United
States.

The fees for the I-600 and fingerprinting were already very expensive, and the
proposal is for them to increase . I have also heard the Certificate of Citizenship
fee will also be increased. If you add these increases to nearly cost-prohibitive
fees from adoption agencies and fees the foreign countries charge, some people
are either not going to be able to become parents, or, as my family has done, go
into more debt than we can afford. Not every adoptive parent is well-off financially,
and a lot of adult immigrants and their families are barely making mimimum wage.

Immigrants want to "live the American dream." Prospective adoptive parents do
too--to raise a family. Increasing these fees will only make these dreams more
impossible for some. And wasn't it said by Emma Lazarus about welcoming "the
huddled masses yearning to be free"?

I urge you to not make these proposed increases, as it will not only negatively
impact persons wanting to be citizens, but also current citizens.

Thank you for your time and attention.

Sincerely,
Mary Feagley
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Mary Feagley
